Name: SNAFU
Description:
The board for SNAFU (which here is supposedly "Situation Normal All Filled Up" - sure) consists of 100 squares in 5 colors - red, blue, green, and yellow, all of which are assigned to the players, plus pink. Each player or team (the 4-player game is for teams) takes a color of chips, white or black.

On a turn a player spins a spinner which produces a result from 0-5 in one of the board colors or white.  If the color is pink or a friendly color, the player places markers in the number of spaces shown.  If an opposing color, the player may choose to place the opposing markers on the board.  If white, the player takes opposing markers off the board.

The game ends when one of four possible conditions are met - one team controls the main diagonal of the board, one team controls all squares of their colors, etc.  None of these conditions automatically win the game, but some add points to the team's score.

Name: Scoop: The Newspaper Game!
Description:
Scoop was one of Western's games distributed by Leisure Home Parties, which apparently was an early attempt at a home party sales approach to games. It has nothing to do with the Waddingtons/Parker Brothers game of the same name.

In this game, each player represents a newspaper trying to fill its front page, represented by a 6x8 grid. Players move around the main board buying, auctioning, and trading stories, which are thin tiles in four different sizes. The stories must be placed upright on the newspaper boards and must fit together without overlapping. Some stories have events on them, and all have fake headlines and leads.

Name: Slaughter & Carnage: Kursk's Stalingrad at Ponyri
Description: two 11 x 17 mapsheets, 560 DTP counters. Tactical recreation of the battle of Ponyri, during July 7-10, 1943 at platoon level for tanks and company level for infantry and artillery. Lots of tanks on both side, on the German side, Ferdinand, Brummbar, Pz III, Pz IV, Marders and Sturmgeschutz, on the Russian side T-34, of course, plus KV-1, SU-152, T-60, T-70, and plenty of antitank guns and other artillery in addition to the infantry. Beautiful counters. Tense slugfest over a town located on the Northern salient of Kursk which is astride of the main German efforts

Name: Tonkin: La Guerre d'Indochine 1950-1954
Description:
Tonkin - La Guerre d'Indochine ("Tonkin - The Indochina War") covers the Indochine war from 1950, date of the take of power of Communists in China and the beginning of their support to Viet Minh troops, to 1954 and the battle of Dien Bien Phu.

It has four scenarios which can played individually or can be combined in a single campaigns, beginning with one of the four scenarios and ending the game in any other one.

Name: Candyman: Farewell to the Flesh
Description:
From the rules:

"As you travel the streets of New Orleans looking for pieces of the puzzle to solve the Candyman Murder mysteries you have to make sure you do not become a victim yourself. To win, player must proceed clockwise along the streets of New Orleans and get to the Mansion with the key card in order to unlock the secret to Candyman's power."

1 playing board, 1 die, 10 Hook Cards, 19 Candyman Cards, 1 Mansion Key Card, 30 Voodoo Cards, and 5 player tokens.

"Inspired by the imagination of the Gramercy Pictures Marketing Team and Designed by Jacobson & Atkins Advertising, Inc.  For Promotional & Publicity use only."

Name: Monstern! Brettspiel
Description:
Game description by the publisher:
"A game by ASSASSIN, in co-production with Lutz Leischner. 
A nice boardgame with tin miniatures, which should not be taken too seriously. We just call it Monstern!"

The game includes several nice tin miniatures, a gameboard and several dice.

Name: Thurn und Taxis: Der Kurier der Fürstin
Description:
The October (5/06) issue of Spielbox magazine included a small expansion for Thurn and Taxis.

Expands:

    Thurn and Taxis
Families: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

Name: Escape the Blob
Description:
In a colorful fantasy setting, players try to escape from the Schmunzelmonster (a tentacled alien monster). Each player has 4 Schlammhüpfers ('mud hoppers', the pawns), who try to escape from getting eaten by the Schmunzelmonster by throwing 2 dice. The first die determines if players get to move their Schlammhüpfers or the Schmunzelmonster (â…” chance). The second die determines how far they must move. 
On a player's turn, if they still have a Schlammhüpfer in the safety of their burrow, they need to move it out before they may move another one on the board. Schlammhüpfer can cover quite a lot of distance because they skip occupied spots. That is needed, however, to get away from the ravenous monster.

The player with the last Schlammhüpfer remaining wins the game. Schmunzelmonster is a beautiful and colorful game for ages 6 and up.

Name: At the Beach
Description:
Content:
27 picture cards, 4 value stones, 1 pawn, 1 dog, board

In this game a young boy walks around the strand and looks to see what he can discover there. When he meets his girlfriend he has to tell what he has seen.
The winner is the player who first reaches the field with the sun with his value stone.

Each turn players get tiles with pictures of common beach objects, and each turn they try to remember, in order, the previous tiles they have seen.  Remembering correctly earns you points, and the first to 11 points wins.

Name: Full of Dollars
Description:
The game contains 160 cards and 85 notes and has got a mafia theme.  To win the game you have to be the richest player and to ruin the others.

Steal sports cars, repaint them, get into the sex industry, open a night club or a gambling club, it's all good to be full of dollars.
Make alliances, rob the bosses who are falling asleep on a large pile of bills, call the police and sell your enemies to justice. During the trial, take advantage of it by sticking a good piece of plastic in their casino, this will reset your competitions to zero!
The next day, when the poker game between bosses arrives, learn that with a few more aces, you always have a better game. The other players won't hesitate to cheat!
But be careful, don't insult a boss who plays honestly, he will make you pay dearly, very dearly!



Devenez le plus riche des caids an ruinant vos adversaires!
Volez des voitures de sport, repegnez-les, lancez vousdans l'industrie du sexe, ouvrez un night club ou un cercle de jeu, tout est bon pur etre full of dollars.
Faites des alliances, braquez les caids qui s'endorment sur un gros paquet de billets, appelez la police et vendez vos ennemis a la justice. Pendant le proces, profitez-en pur coller un bon pain de plastic dans leur casino, cela remettra lex competes a zero!
Le sour, quand arrive la partie de poker entre boss, apprenez qu'avec qeulques as de plus, on a toujous un meilleur jeu. Les autres jouers, eux n'hesiteront pas a tricher!
Mais attention, n'insultez pas un caid qui joue honnetement, il vous le fera payer cher, tres cher!

Name: Wooden Shoes & Iron Monsters
Description:
from Winsome Games:

"Wooden Shoes & Iron Monsters" is a Riding Series game by Han Heidema. WS&IM is set in the Netherlands and covers to history of the Dutch railroads from 1830 to 2006. WS&IM is for 3-5 players for about 2-3 hours. Players start railroads, capitalize them with shares of stock, build track from city to city, receive income and later merge smaller railroads into larger railroads. Prior games in this series include West Riding, LÃ¤nderbahnen and Riding through England.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Eastern US & Canada
Description:
This Age of Steam expansion extends the base game Rust Belt map to include the Eastern USA and Canada, from Savannah, Georgia to Quebec, Canada. Both maps are used together to play this 3-6 player game. The game introduces the Marketing action and new rules concerning track building, interurban links, goods growth and production.
This expansion was released as a limited, numbered Essen Set by Winsome Games at Essen 2006. A thematic Turn Order marker was also included with the numbered Essen Set.

Expands:

    Age of Steam

Name: Kursk 1943: End of the Blitzkrieg, The Northern Pincer
Description:
Main issue game contained in Alea Magazine issue 31.

Kursk 1943: The Northern Pincer, the End of Blitzkrieg (Part I) is a regiment-brigade simulation of the offensive of the 9th German Army during the battle of Kursk.

Name: Colorful Caterpillars
Description:
Colorful Caterpillars is a fun children's tactics game. The game is to get all of their own larvae first on to the game board. Players place their larvae on to the game board in turns. A great maneuvering game, where the larvae can be put this way, that someone else need to take theirs off or can't put their on to the board. Age range of more than 4 years.
Each player gets larvae pictured tiles, where in every single one of those is two holes, but they are in different places. One in head and tail of the larvae, or body and tail and so on. The tiles are in four different colors for each player. The game board have different colored circles on it, and your goal is to make your larvae complete by placing them in a way the circle match the color underneath (yellow to yellow). Win by getting rid of your tiles first.

Name: House Rules
Description:
The hilarious game that brings families together. This game is a fast paced-team game that provides hours of exciting game play while giving players opportunities to discuss family values, issues, tradition, and tasks in fun, laughter-filled environment. Teams race against the clock to come up with lists of answers to hundreds of statements and questions in 6 family oriented categories

Includes full color game board featuring the rooms and activities found in an ordinary house, 115 situation cards with close to 700 questions in 6 categories, 15 action cards with Bible verses, crazy actions and rewards, 2 playing pieces (plus 2 extra; 1 of each color), 30 second timer, die, and instructions

Name: Mestarietsivä Basil Hiiri
Description:
Mestarietsivä Basil Hiiri (Fin.) / Mästerdetektiven Basil Mus (Swe.) (English: "The Master-Detective Basil Mouse") is a board game based on the Walt Disney movie Basil the Great Mouse Detective. Players follow the footsteps of the great mouse detective through the streets of London as he chases Professor Ratigan and his gang.

In the game players use numbered cards to travel from one corner of the board to another via roads and rotating crossroads. Crossroads can be used to hinder other players. The goal of the game is to get into Big Ben (Clock Tower / now: Elizabeth Tower) when the clock hits twelve o'clock.

Name: Stereo-5
Description: Stereo-5 is a 3-dimensional variation of 4-in-a-row game. Players use plastic pieces which can be attached to each other from six sides and they can be rotated if not "anchored" to main playing structure. Goal is to get 5 or more own colored pieces in a row in one of the three axis.

Name: Trinity
Description:
Trinity is a New Zealand designed and published abstract strategy game for 2 players.  The game is played on a 4 by 4 square grid, which is marked a-d on the horizontal axis and 1-4 on the vertical axis for record keeping.

There are three types of pieces, which are identical for black and white.  First are the ORBS, which are circular pieces with red, yellow, green or blue in the center. The second type of pieces are ARCS, which have a stripe of color matching those of the orbs.  The arcs are 120 degrees in extension, so three arcs fit around an orb.  HALOS are the third piece type, and are either white or black.  They are rings which fit outside the orbs and arcs.  There are four orbs, four arcs and six halos of each color, made of plastic.

The orbs are set up on the 1 and 4 rows with the matching color arcs with those orbs.  Play consists of each player moving one orb one square horizontally, vertically or diagonally.  The matching color of arc MUST be then moved.  Arcs can move to any other legal square on the board.

The easiest way to win is to trap an opposing orb with three arcs of any color around it (an Arc-win).  If you can box in your opponents orbs so that he has no valid moves, then you have gained an Orb-win.  Finally, if you can move your four pieces inside four halos of your own color you have completed a halo win.  A draw is an option through player agreement or stalemate from repeated moves.

A halo is "earned" by moving three of your arcs so that they form a complete ring, with no orbs inside it.  The arcs then attack the opposing pieces of the same strip color as the arcs.

The game rules come in a 16-page A6 sized rule book. There is also a CD for Windows PCs to practice strategies.

Name: Schneckenrennen
Description:
Which snail will win the exciting race, roll the right colors on their dice and reach the goal first? Watch out: Not only speed counts! If you run too fast you can easily stumble and get a knot on you snail's tail... and that costs time! Therefore remember, dear snail, that more haste makes less speed, and be careful so that you reach your goal safely.

Or, as they would say in Germany:

Welche Schnecke wird wohl das spannende Rennen gewinnen, die richtige Farbe würfeln und als erste ans Ziel gelangen? Doch aufgepasst: Nich nur die Geschwindigkeit zählt! Denn wer zu schnell läuft, kann leicht stolpern und einen Knoten in seinen Schneckenschwanz bekommen... und das kostet Zeit! Darum, liebe Schnecke, eile mit Weile und Bedacht, damit du heil am Ziel ankommst.

Name: Black Americans of Achievement: The Game
Description:
This question and answer style game is played by groups of two to six. Players/partners "bet" on the success of the answers with points. The objective: answer your question correctly or guess whether another landing player will answer his or her question correctly, winning or losing points accordingly.

This game presents very positive role models in a way that heightens one's awareness of the achievements of Black Americans. Be inspired by the triumphs and struggles of both celebrated and unheralded Black Achievers who are part of this heritage of American success.

The box states that the game is "Based on Chelsea House Publisher's critically acclaimed 'Black Americans of Achievement' series of books, drawing from the expertise of the W.E.B. DuBois Institute of Afro-American Research, Harvard University", and was "sponsored by Burger King and Grolier Books".

Name: Unter Uns
Description:
This game is the graduation work of a student of visual communication in Weimar.
In the game players assume the roles of illegal immigrants trying to acquire a German passport while living from illegal work and evading the police.

Home Page: http://www.keinpasskeinspass.de/

Name: The Little Wooden Train Game
Description:
translated from Dutch cover:
Choo Choo, The train is about to leave!

All aboard? The passengers have lost their luggage at different stations and the players have to help them find their luggage. This is achieved by traveling by train from station to station. Good memory may help you find your luggage. The player who is the first to find his or her three pieces of luggage wins.

Name: Roars of Laughter
Description:
It's a set of ninety cards in two categories: questions and answers.  From the box, it's a "merry question and answer card game for merry parties".

The questions begin with "What would you do if...".  The answers are along the lines of "I would soak it in milk".

Name: Where's Wally? The Game
Description:
Where's Wally? The Game is based on the Where's Wally books by Martin Handford who also designed this game.

The game is played by using a spinner and counters around a fixed board.

Aim: The aim of the game is to be the first player to reach the designated finishing place (in this case a large question mark) To achieve this, players must complete a series of observational questions outlined on the cards using the picture boards included.

Name: Placar
Description: This game simulates a soccer match. Two players roll dice, moves your teams and try to mark the biggest number of goals.

Name: The Nobel Game
Description: Nobelspelet is a Chutes and Ladders type of game with humorous (but still somewhat realistic) depictions of the steps in a scientific career. Players roll a golden six-sided die and move along the path from birth to the Nobel prize.  Good rolls move you ahead fast, poor rolls give you long detours or move you backwards.  Ironically (or not!) this game to win the Nobel prize requires no skill.  Published jointly by the Nobel Prize Museum in Stockholm, and Alga in Vittsjö, in honour of the 2001 Centennial of the Nobel prize.

Name: Casey Jones Game Box
Description: The Casey Jones Game Box contains three games: Blow the Whistle, Capital Run, and Freight Train.  All games are played with a single die, and (at most) 20 train cars.  Blow the Whistle is a simple race game for two players, playable by children as young as three-years-old. Players roll and move, with the requirement that they make horn sounds at certain points in the game.  The first player to reach the finish line wins.  Capital Run is a game for older children, with up to four players.  This game also has a roll-and-move mechanic, and players must successfully name state capitals in order to earn a turn, with the object to cross the country on a preset path.  Freight train is light but nontrivial game for two players, requiring players to assemble a set of different types of trains.  These trains (coal tender, box car, flat car, cattle car) begin the game on preset spaces, and players must roll around the board and assemble their set.  There are several opportunities for decisions.

Name: Safely Home
Description: The object of the game is to travel from school through the neighborhood and arrive home safely with the most Safety Tokens. Along the way, players encounter real life situations that require safe and smart decision making. Opportunities to earn Safety Tokens by using code words, "Safe Spot" locations and buddying up present themselves with every turn, as well as opportunities to say "No" to the dangerous "Stranger". The more advanced version of the game utilizes Safety Situation cards, extra chances to earn Safety Tokens and emphasize the rules of personal safety.

Name: Davy Crockett Adventures
Description:
Walt Disney's Davy Crockett Adventures, basically each player tries to collect all four Davy Crockett adventure cards onto his playing rack. 
These consist of: 'Davy Grins the Bear' , 'Davy Fights Redstick' ,'Davy Goes to Congress' , and 'Davy at the Alamo'
This collection process involves the spinning of a spinner (which is a picture of Fess Parker as Davy Crockett holding a rifle) when the rifle points to one of the adventure cards it is yours. The only catch is that you have to collect the adventures in the order that they happened.

Name: The Singing Bone
Description:
Who Will Try to Slay the Dragon First? The object is to be the first player to slay the dragon. Players use a spinner to move. They are trying to collect enough "Dragon Cards" (20)so that they can enter the "Dragons Secret Cave". Once in the cave players do battle with the Dragon by spinning the spinner if you spin the number "one" the Dragon is has been slain, any other number and you have to make another round through the cave and try again.

This is based on one of the episodes in the movie The Wonderful World of the Brothers Grimm.

Name: The Adventures of Popeye
Description: Object: Four different Popeye Adventures are illustrated on the board. The object of play is for the player to win each of the four adventures by "eating" enough cans of spinach (wooden green discs), which are won in the "Grand Spinach Lottery". After winning an adventure the player receives an Adventure Card. The first player to win all four Adventure Cards and get to the finish is the winner of the game. The game has a typical spinner, cards, wooden "cans of spinach", and a "Grand Spinach Lottery" which is a box that you shake tokens out of, the tokens state how many cans of spinach you will receive.

Name: Jr. Quarterback Football Game
Description:
from the Box for the Tee Pee Toys version: All the Thrills of a Big Game: Running Plays, Passing Plays, Kick-Offs, Punts, Field Goals, Punt Returns.You are the Quarterback! Choose your own Plays! Follow the rules of football. Players each roll dice, the numbers on the dice refer to sequence tables which determine the results of the play (one player rolls for offense, and the other rolls for defense). Before rolling the offensive player must state whether he is going to run, kick, or pass. The game consists of "Four Quarters" four sets of (20) plays each quarter. The player with the highest score at the end wins.

Alternate version: Jr. Quarterback came with short game board, markers for downs and quarter of play, a cardboard football and a deck of 20 cards with plays. One quarter of play was one complete pass through the 20 plays card deck. Thus, the deck would be gone through twice per half and 4 times to complete one game. The offensive player would select a play. The card would be turned over to reveal the results. Following the rules of football i.e., 4 downs to gain 10 yards, 4 quarters of play, etc.) the ball would move up and down the field based on the play called and the associated gain or loss in yardage on the card associated with the play called. The plays that could be called were "left end", "left tackle", "left guard", "right end", "right tackle", "right guard", "short pass" and "long pass" as well as "punt", "kickoff" and "field goal". Each of the running plays had gains and losses as well as one fumble and a no gain. "Long pass" had four interceptions including one that was returned for a touchdown. "Long pass" also offered a touchdown. Short pass had a higher completion rate than long pass and only two interceptions. Jr. Quarterback is a fun game for two young players and can even be played by one. In my opinion ages elementary or for the adult who likes old school board games from a simpler time. Great game for teaching a young child the basics.

Name: Giant Steps
Description:
The Object is to be the first player to cross the street on the blue border "GIANT STEPS" and then back again to his colored "Start" space.
 Draw cards, do what they say in order to move. The game requires good manners to move, you must say "May I" of the person on the right, if you don't you lose your turn.

Name: Barbie's Keys to Fame Game
Description: Object: Build up the "Careers" in the 8 pockets of the tray by playing matching Career Cards, numbered 1 to 6. Whoever spins the spinner to point at the matching Gold Key to Fame takes that career and scores for it later. The winner is the player with the highest score after 2 rounds. The game consists of a tray with eight circular slots, a center spinner on the tray which points to the slots and keys, circular "Careers" cards, and Eight gold keys representing each of the careers.

Name: Underground Railroad Perilous Journey to Freedom
Description: Object: To become the first player to reach freedom in Canada, by answering trivia questions and avoiding the "Patroller" pawn who gets closer for each incorrect answer. Dice are used for only the first turn, after that movement is decided by the trivia cards. The papers inside the box state that there were only 1000 of this game produced.

Name: Waifs and Strays
Description:
These character/story based trading cards were made for spooky girls who have no interest in those angry little characters the boys seem to gravitate to. 16 orphaned girls each have their own unique story of how they became orphaned; each lost an object during their difficult time, developed a magic spell and adopted a pet monster. The girls are all somehow later involved in another tragic death. The cards have point values and there is a game that can be played regardless of how many cards have collected. 8 evil puppet cards are included in the full set.

More information:
http://www.therss.com/store/product_info.php?products_id=41&osCsid=f295fa51966c4cc1ccb021aaff82597f
http://www.therss.com/creepychristine/

Name: Antiquity Trivia Game
Description: A trivia game on antiques and collectibles.  Questions are given in three levels of difficulty: browser, buff, and advanced collector.  Each player chooses a level at the beginning of the game, thus allowing experts to play with beginners.  Each card has a relatively easy question (1 point if correct) and a relatively difficult question (2 points if correct).  Players announce their intention to answer the easy or difficult question before the next card is revealed.  First player to 30 points wins the game.

Name: Julma-Juhan piinapenkki
Description: A sports trivia game that has been published in a collectible set of five decks of 50 cards each, each card with 4 questions, for a total of 1000 questions. Creator Juha Väätäinen is known as the European Champion of 5000m and 10000m running in 1971.

Name: Lapsentekopeli: Tror du på storken
Description:
"The Child Making Game: Do you believe in the stork?"

From the back of the box:

The Child Making Game, intended for the 7th to 9th graders(* of the elementary school, is a fun teaching tool for the health and reproductive biology classes. The game has also been used a lot in youth work.

The game can lessen prejudices about pregnancy and add positive knowledge about pregnancy, childbirth and relationships. The effects of smoking, alcohol and unhealthy habits to the foetus and the expecting mother are informed about precisely and in a matter-of-fact manner.

The Child Making Game has been in use in schools for more than a decade, and has gained plenty of positive feedback from both teachers and pupils.

---


    ) 13-16 year olds.

Name: Doctor Who Battles in Time
Description:
Doctor Who collectible card game comprising 275 cards to collect, including a scratch 'n' sniff Slitheen card.  Released as a partwork each issue includes a pack with 9 cards (8 common and 1 rare).

Also available in booster pack form

The magazine is also a companion guide to the cards, featuring new gameplay rules, tips and tactics, monster fold-outs, episode guides and imagery from the Doctor Who TV series.

Name: Coloraddo
Description: Dice assigns a color tile, tile color placed on board with matching color but more points awarded for longest pattern (line of the same colors--a "Coloraddo") created from reverse of tile.  When tiles are all on the board, the game is over and the winner is the one with the highest score.

Name: Trivagory
Description: Two types of categories, alphabet and general, make up the 99 different trivia categories.  Players try to reach one of the four finish spaces on the center circle and answers the general category question correctly wins.

Name: Malcolm in the Middle
Description: Players answer questions about the Malcolm in the Middle television show while collecting money for right answers.  Wrong answers have the money going to a jackpot.  The first player to collect $100 wins.

Name: State the Facts
Description: Players begin an exciting journey as they take off from any of the six airports on the board.  During your tour, you'll be asked questions about the states you visit.  Answer correctly and you get a colorful souvenir card for that region you're visiting.  Be the first player to collect a souvenir card for all six regions and you're the winner.

Name: The Sex Education Game
Description:
Players must collect a complete set of 6 male or female sex organ cards.  To win with the male organs, he/she must collect 500 million sperm and then land on the motel. To win with the female organs, he/she must also have one unfertilized egg and land on the bedroom.

The male sex organs are:

Snake of Life
Jewel Plum of Naughty Desires
Valve of Relief
Horn of Plenty
Boulevard of Urgency
Sack of Containment

The female sex organs are:

Gates of Forbidden Pleasures
Avenue of Rapture
Digit of Delight
Tube of Sanctuary
Basket of Hidden Danger
Hall of Conception

Name: Ultima
Description: ULTIMA is the lone non-card game included in Robert Abbott's excellent book "Abbott's New Card Games". It uses a chessboard & chess pieces, and is one of the more aberrant chess variants.

Name: Das Flensburger Förde Spiel
Description:
The game is a commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting the area of the "Flensburger Förde", a landscape in the North of Germany.
The players move around a board, which consists of 40 squares. On most of the squares are parts of companies, which can be bought. The companies have values between 1000 and 8000 Euro. Three companies are combined by a color. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he must draw a card and the wins and losses of the business year are settled. According to the outcome the players gain money or have to pay money for their companies.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends and all company cards are sold for their original price.

Name: Patrol Torpedo (Second Edition)
Description:
Patrol Torpedo

Patrol Torpedo is a game representing tactical naval combat between coastal forces during World War II.  The player assumes the role of motor torpedo or gun boat skippers and their opponents, up to and including destroyers and other small escort craft.

Game Scale and Conventions


The game is designed to be played using miniature figures and terrain.  The game is generally played using figures in the scale of 1/300 or 1/600 scale.1 turn - 50 Seconds
1 cm   - 25 Meters
1 Knot - 1 cm of movement

Name: Bahnfahren macht Spaß
Description: A game for families with children. The players move around the board, which consists of several pictures of trains and everything involved with them. Whenever a player hits a pictograph, he can draw one card of the 68 travel-cards. If it is a pictograph, it is placed according to its position on the board and the player can move again. Players can move with every pawn and in the end the player with the most travel-cards wins.

Name: Bratz Rockin' Chic Board Game
Description:
From the back of the box:

Rock to the top!  It's a race to stardom at the biggest rock concert of the year!  Take a spin to create a stylin' wardrobe!  Gather rockin' music and stock up on lots of bling!  The right combination will land you onstage, where you win the game- and you rock the spotlight!

Name: Gänsemarsch
Description:
A children's game, consisting of 32 cards with geese on both sides and a dice. The 32 cards are arranged in a spiral and all players start from the first card. After throwing the dice the player moves accordingly forward on the spiral. If he lands on a card, he has to turn it around and follow its instructions.
The card symbols are sometimes advantageous (e.g. take another turn), sometimes disadvantageous (e.g. sit out one turn). The players can also move other pawns of other players to move them on disadvantageous cards. Therefore it is essential to remember what text is on the backside of the cards. 
If two geese meet, one has to follow the orders from the backside of the card, the other must go back to the card where the first goose came from. The player wins, whose goose first passes the last card of the spiral.

Name: Spiderrinth
Description:
Who will be the first to catch the fly in the middle?

Spiderrinth is a fun and tactical game, where the objective is to be the first to make a trail from one's home field inwards to the fly in the center of the web.

The trail is established by turning the treads and putting chips on the flies. When all the flies from one's home field to the center of the web is covered by a chip, you move your piece onto the prey in the center and thereby win the game - but only if you remember to say "Spiderrinth"!

(From the box - translated from Danish)

Name: Mount St. Helens Volcano Game
Description: Dice determines how many spaces a player can move on the board.  When landing on certain locations a player may accumulate certain points.  Only 24 turns are allowed for each player as each round corresponds with an historical milestone leading to the eruption of Mt. Saint Helens on May 19, 1980 (edit: it was May 18th...).  It is possible for no player to win the game if all players are still in the red zone after the 24 historical milestones are reached.  Each historical milestone may give conditional instructions to players depending on where they are on the board.  Also, certain spots on the board may provide additional instructions...or instruct the player to draw from the emergency deck.

Name: American Trivia Challenge California Style
Description: A player moves ahead on the board with a piece by rolling the die or pair of dice.  The landing space has a color.  A card of the same color is drawn.  If the player can correctly answer the question, the player can throw the dice and move ahead again.  Also, the player is given a puzzle piece matching the color/category if the player does not already have that piece.  The first player to complete a flag (using the puzzle pieces), return to California and answer a final question, wins.

Name: Dinozoo
Description: Your rocket ship is a time machine made by Professor Smarty, the world's greatest scientist.  He wants you to journey back to the age of dinosaurs to catch the best ones for his new zoo - the DinoZoo.  If you do, he will make you Head DinoZookeeper.  You get points by catching dinosaurs and getting bonus chips.  The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: All About Savannah
Description: An exciting game for all ages about Savannah!  Also includes $100 worth of coupons for local businesses!

Name: Stoner City
Description:
Yet, another Monopoly (q.v.) clone with a marijuana theme. The differences between this and the older game are: players start with $1650 (instead of $1500), it only takes three of this game's version of houses to upgrade to this game's version of a hotel, there is a Police Car token that moves on everybody's turn in the opposite direction of the players. When the Police Car occupies the same space as a player then that player is sent to Rehab (this game's version of Jail).

Includes: Game Board, 5 Player Tokens, Play Money, 36 Kharma Cards, 27 Certificates of Stonership, 1 Police Car, 15 Plant Pieces, 32 Crop Pieces and 2 Stonerware Dice.
It appears that this game was produced without a Certificates of Stonership card for the Cheech's Bail Bonds space.

Name: The 3 Stooges Fun House
Description:
This is a children's game with a 3-D board (when the cardboard is properly assembled).  The most prominent part of the board is the large slide along one side of the board.

From the box: 
"Side Splitting Hi-Jinks with The 3 STOOGES in a Real Zany Fun House!"

Name: Domorino
Description:
Domorino is a color recognition and strategy game. Children create their own set of Dominoes using colored chips and domino frames and think more strategically. The first person who places all of his colored chips wins.

Age: 4+

Name: Pisa
Description:
Pisa is a strategy and fine motor skills game. Roll the dice to see how many pieces must be used. Start by building one level and move up to building four. Try to avoid a leaning tower as you carefully place bamboo pieces to support more levels.

Age: 4+

Name: Dicey Dunces
Description:
From the cover:
"A Pop-O-Matic game for younger children" (ages 4-9)

Dunce hats of four different colors square off by lining up along each edge of the square board with a Pop-O-Matic bubble in the middle.

Name: Maselino
Description:
Maselino is a game of speed. 40 Colorful bamboo discs are distributed by color to players who pretend they are mice looking for food. The players turn the tiles over until their pictures match. When they do, the players rob the piece of food from the plates in the middle. Only the quickest one can keep it. The winner is the one who gets the most pieces of food.

Age: 4+

Name: Scoot!
Description:
Scoot is a children's spin-and-move game.  Featuring smiling children on the cover, the gameboard is a yard with a winding sidewalk up to the front door of a house.  The house stands up for a 3-d game board.

Scoot on home now!

From the front cover:
"New! Fast! Different! Exciting! Fun!"

Name: Battelo
Description:
Battelo is a memory and strategy game. Players move their panda bear through the forest according to the memo tiles they draw and try to be the first to collect 4 different colored leaves in their backpacks.

Age: 4+

Name: Tom and Jerry: Adventures in Blunderland
Description: This is a children's roll and move game (actually, spin and move) based on the cartoon Tom and Jerry.  Four colored spinners are included with the game.  The pieces are cardboard stand-ups for moving around the board.

Name: Godfathers & Goodfellas: The Organized Crime Trivia Game
Description: "Godfathers & Goodfellas" is a trivia board game that is driven by the popularity of the "wiseguy" genre, particularly in movies and on TV series such as “The Sopranos.” The game consists of a series of categories relevant to the 'mob scene' with questions in each category. The player is a good guy -- a special agent assigned to break up the mob by answering questions. With every correct answer, down goes another bad guy. The harder the question the bigger the bad guy … until the whole gang is gone.

Name: Cowboy Riders and Indians
Description:
"COWBOY RIDERS AND INDIANS" is as fresh and exciting as a ride across the Western plains. A brightly dec. orated metal wheel spins off numbers. Four "Wild West" riders move across hostile Indian country, in an effort to reach the safety of the military fort. The printed story along the trail is exciting and results are different each time it is played.

— from an advertisement

Name: Avesta!
Description: Avesta! is an abstract game themed loosely on the Zend Avesta - the sacred texts of Zoroaster (also called Zarathustra). It is chess-like in the powers and types of moves available, but there are a few spaces on the board that are limited to certain pieces, some pieces are used for blocking only, and some pieces are promoted when others are captured, which can tip the balance, making a capture or sacrifice critical to the outcome. There are two winning conditions: either the capture of the opponent’s offensive pieces, or the defilement (occupation) of your opponent’s temple for a full turn.

Name: Clown
Description:
Remember the clowns clothes!

Objective for the game:
Try to remember how the clown on the clown card was dressed, and give the clown on the basic card the same clothes before the timer runs out!
The player who has collected the most points after 10 turns wins.

(From the box - translated from Danish)

Name: Gift of Enlightenment
Description:
From the advertisement:

Gift of Enlightenment is a unique and totally original board game that brings a flow of positive energy to all who discover it. Friends and family will be delighted by its healing messages and fun game play. This is one adventure that is guaranteed to stay in the mind long after the final dice has been thrown.

Game Features: - Seek your very own ‘Gift of Enlightenment’. Make life-changing decisions as you travel the ‘Circle of Life’.  Win and lose positive and negative human traits along the way.  Harness the energy around you. It can help you to reach the ultimate goal.  How powerful are your Sixth Sense, Insight, and Intuition?  Here’s your chance to find out as you seek to master the ‘Seven Chakra Challenges’.  Collect the Seven Chakra Crystals that can help you to open the wonderful ‘Book of Enlightenment’.

Delve into the mysterious Karma Pool.  Try to avoid falling for False Idols.  Gain a personal gift from the ‘Book of Enlightenment’.

Each beautifully boxed game contains: -

Game board

7 special Chakra stones with velvet holding bag.

6 Aura cards

3 packs of game cards

42 Chakra crystals (acrylic)

7 Chakra color cards

7 Chakra Challenges.

Wooden Dice

Full Instructions

Plus the 82 page ‘Book of Enlightenment’

Name: Little Angels and the Fruit of the Spirit
Description:
Little Angels and the Fruit of the Spirit

As players move their little angels along the brightly colored path, they will be introduced to the names and meanings of all nine Fruits of the Spirit from Galatians 5:22.

Name: Steward
Description:
Steward

In STEWARD, your mission is to manage and multiply the riches that have been entrusted to you.

Great riches are in your hands • What will you do with them

Make different purchase in order to produce olive oil, clay pots, food grains, clothes and more. Buy and export stone to build houses or temples or become the biggest copper producer in your area.  Discover the Biblical Principles that will make you a Great Steward! Never forget to tithe on all your income. It will be the key to your prosperity. Use strategy to succeed in the challenge that has been entrusted to you and by doing so become THE BEST STEWARD.

STEWARD • A captivating game that you will certainly enjoy and that will be the source of many unforgettable moments with your family and your friends.

Name: Professor Noggin's The Human Body Card Game
Description:
Do you wonder about sneezing, saliva or your sense of smell? Ever ponder scabs, snoring or sweat? Then this game, all about YOU, is for you!

Professor Noggin's series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects.  Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions.  A special three-numbered die is included which creates interaction and promotes communication between players.  Easy and hard levels keep kids interested and challenged - while of course having fun!

Name: Parts of Speech Challenge!
Description:
Parts of Speech Challenge reinforces knowledge of nouns, verbs, adjectives, adverbs, prepositions, pronouns, conjunctions and interjections! 
 Parts of Speech Challenge helps players master the eight basic parts of speech plus verb phrases, prepositional phrases, articles, and proper nouns. Players learn how the same word can represent different parts of speech based on how it is used in a sentence.
 As they move around the board, drawing cards and reading sentences, players identify the parts of speech of selected words. All words are used in sentence context for meaningful learning.
 The Reference Sheet, included, allows players to familiarize themselves with the parts of speech. Younger players can use the Reference Sheet while playing the game.
 The object is to cover the most spaces on the board before one player runs out of markers. The player with the highest score wins!

Name: Il Golpe
Description:
Wargame for two players, originally included with issues no. 728, 729 (the regular 6-sided die) and 730 of Italian magazine "Panorama", in spring 1980.

From the rules' sheet:

"Il Golpe, a bespoke creation for "Panorama", is a war game based on a hypothetical military coup in Italy.
The game's flow simulates the typical putsch's mechanics: mutiny of military units, assaults against TV broadcasting stations, airports, nuclear plants and naval bases, riots in the streets.
The game represents a single day of war, consisting in 8 phases of 3 hours each. At the beginning of the game the "rebel" player secretly compiles a list with the opponent's  units that will mutiny, then the "government" player places his army and only after this stage is the list revealed.  At the end of the game the total value of the "strategic goals" achieved by the "rebel" player is calculated, and if his total score is higher than the "government" player's one (the sum of the objectives still under his control) the coup d'etat is successful."

Contents: 
Map of Italy (84 x 39,5 cm) with reference charts embedded;
107 cardboards chits;
1 dice;

Name: Safari Yum
Description:
A simple and fun dice game for young children!  Players roll five dice with animal pictures (lion, monkey, giraffe, crocodile, elephant and hippo) on each side, and try to collect sets of matching animals.  The "Lion" picture is "wild".  After the first roll, players are allowed to re-roll the dice of their choice up to two times.  Players then place the equivalent number of matching animal tokens on their playing board.  This process is repeated for each player five times.  The winner is the player with the most monkey, giraffe, crocodile, elephant and hippo tokens on their playing board!  Suitable for children age 4 and older.

Contents:

     4 play boards 
     100 chips 
     5 dice 
     1 dice cup 
     1 sticker sheet 
     instructions

Name: Hickery Dickery Clock
Description:
Hickery Dickery Clock is an easy game for children age 4 and up, about telling time and matching funny faces.

Object: Race against Timothy Mouse by striking each hour of the clock before turning up all 4 Timothy Mouse cards.  Players win by matching all the hours on the clock before the last Timothy Mouse card is turned up.

Contents: 

     5 piece jigsaw game board with clock hands
     deck of game cards with clock pictures

Name: Mithril
Description:
In Mithril, each player plays a team of dwarves exploring a mine to discover buried valuables, such as gold, beer, mithril and a treasure chest. Players must dig carefully to avoid being crushed in a cave-in, as the mines' stability is unpredictable, and the other players can sometimes trigger cave-ins and other hazards.

The game ends when a players brings the treasure chest back to his entrance. Then, the richest player wins the game.

The game is still under development.

Name: Flink
Description: Flink's unique gameplay combines the fun of shuffleboard with the skill of pool! Using the "Flink sticks", players "flink" discs to be nearest the backboard. Knock your opponent off the board, into the "gutter" and out of play! The player whose disc is closest to the backboard after flinking five discs each wins that round. The player who wins five rounds first has won the game.

Name: Stress Strategies
Description: Players must think of solutions to the stressful situations that they meet in the game and then discuss the results.  Everyone wins in Stress Strategies by listening, sharing, and accepting the feelings and responses of all the players, and by learning healthy ways to manage stress.

Name: Nimm uns mit, Jim Knopf!
Description: Based on the popular book by Michael Ende. One player takes the role of Jim Knopf, who wants to take as many friends as possible with him in Lukas' - who is played by another player - locomotive Emma. But even in Lummerland - the imaginary island, where the train tracks lead around - you need a ticket to ride the train. And it isn't as easy to get one of those...

Name: Sandmann, lieber Sandmann
Description:
This is a very simple roll-and-move game from the former East Germany (DDR) -- the game is pictured in the Taschen Icons Book _DDR_Design_.  From the appearance in the book, it's a bedtime game for children -- players roll the die and move their piece, and follow the directions when they land on certain spaces -- e.g. move forward, wait for two turns, etc.

John Blund is known in Scandinavian as a mythological little man who calms the children and helps them to sleep.

The goal of the game is to reach the finish point first. Just roll the die and move. If you end up on a "action"-field just follow the simple instructions.

Name: Zzzymble
Description:
Zzzymble is a card game inspired by Sudoku and is a fast paced card game that is fun for all ages.

The box contains cards with five suits, containing the numbers 1-9, plus various special cards that affect gameplay. Players are trying to play their cards into a 5x5 grid. Cards may not be played adjacently (orthogonally or diagonally) to another card that match either number or color. When the grid is full, players sum card values remaining in their hands. Over a number of rounds (playing to 100 points), the winner is the player with the fewest points.

A planned forthcoming expansion is called "It's as Zzzymble as Zzzat."

Name: Alpenreise
Description:
The board shows the German Alps and the villages and cities situated in that area. The different locations are connected by lines.
The players draw a card and place a flag into the according location. In addition they draw cards from every color on the board, which then represents their travel route. Other cards are telegram cards (describing a special occurrence) and pass cards (which are used to travel over mountains).
The players roll a dice and move accordingly. Whoever manages to visit all his locations and returns to his starting point first, wins.

Name: What Will You Find
Description: Help Pip & Pop, Tutter and Ojo find their favorite things hidden in Bear's yard.  Spin to move ahead.  Land on special spaces and turn over Bush tokens to see what's hidden where.  Find two of your character's favorite things and reach Bear's house first to win.

Name: Anti-Grid
Description: Anti-Grid is an abstract strategy game for two players, each trying to eliminate the other’s pieces through capture. The unique thing about the board is that each player plays on his/her own grid - they never follow the same paths to victory or defeat. Capture is made by flanking, or trapping an opponent’s piece between two of your own, and players may set up “barricades” to impede their opponent’s moves (momentarily, anyway). There are two boards included with a larger and a smaller grid, allowing shorter or longer, more challenging games.

Name: Double Trouble
Description: Each player spins to establish their color.  The 24 puzzle pieces are evenly distributed.  The red player starts by trying to put the puzzle together while the person on their left is trying to spin red's color.  When red is spun, the player spinning tries to put the puzzle together while the person on their left tries to spin that persons color.  The first player to use all of their puzzle pieces is the winner.

Name: Kiss My Ass
Description: Players are dealt all of the cards in the deck and the starting player takes a card from the person on their left.  They can either kiss that body part of the person who they took the card from or leave it in their hand.  When you lose all of your cards, you are safe.  When the next to last player is out of cards the loser is the one holding the Kiss My Ass card.

Name: Crazy 8ths
Description: Crazy 8ths is a music based educational card game that introduces many variants to popular card games, and is designed to help children learn to read music.

Name: Mad Gab Mania
Description:
Classic Mad Gab goes digital as Mad Gab Mania adds visual and audio clues as well as other challenges that creates a whole new way to play.  Programmable Game Buzzers let teams compete head to head for lightning-quick play!

Features:
- Steal points by unscrambling "Scramble Swipes."
- You make the choice and control the game with "Pass or Play."
- If you're behind, you can get help from "The Equalizer."

Name: Monopoly: Astronomy
Description: Another Monopoly variant.  Utilities are replaced by observatories, railroads by telescope manufacturers and properties by celestial bodies.  The pewter pieces are: radio telescope, telescope in dome, Hubble Space Telescope, Schmidt-Cassegrain telescope, binoculars and lawn chair.

Name: Cribbage: The Board Game
Description: “Cribbage - The Board Game” is a simple, fast game for anyone who enjoys playing the traditional cribbage card game. Unlike the traditional card game, the board game can only be played with two teams and therefore cannot be played by three players. Fortunately (and uniquely) this cribbage game can be played very well with six players forming two teams of three. Each team alternates play by placing a card on the board from their dealt hand. The board is a five by five grid with a face down card in the center revealed only after all cards are played. At the end of each round one team will score the cribbage “hands” that form the “rows” while the other team scores the cribbage “hands” that form the “columns”.  Every card placed will become a card in one of your cribbage “hands” on the board but will also be a card in one of your opponents “hands”. The trick therefore is to strategically place cards in such a way to help yourself but hinder your opponent. The board also has card values printed on some spots for instant scoring. Placing a queen on a spot on the board with a queen printed on it will score an instant two points - just as matching a pair during regular play would in a traditional cribbage game. Placing a five on the same queen spot would similarly score an instant two points for the fifteen. Final scoring is done after all spaces are filled using the same procedure one uses for a traditional cribbage hand. First team to 121 wins. If you like to play cribbage, especially with a group, this is a fun twist on one of the world’s oldest card games.

Name: Bok
Description: Quoted from the game box: “BOK is a fast paced strategy game that is more demanding and challenging than Backgammon or Chess. Truly a remarkable and intriguing concept, unparalleled in the history of games.  BOK will remain unchallenged in years to come as The Ultimate Strategy Game.”

Name: Panama
Description:
This game is one of the winners of the 2006 Boulogne-Billancourt International Designer Contest.

In Panama, players are mission leaders that strive to complete the first canal joining the Atlantic and Pacific oceans. Three projects are under study: one in Panama itself, another one in Mexico and one in Nicaragua.

To win the game, the players must not only dig the canals, but they must also hire experts, emit lotteries to fund their mission, buy shares in the different projects, and invest wisely in the six resources required when building a canal.

Name: Salut les Filles!
Description:
Salut Les Filles! must be played within a public area, such as a pub or coffee.

Players play cards describing a physical element that can be found on a person, such as long hair, cell phone, she kisses me, etc...

The first player to spot a person with at least one attribute on a card gets the card and marks a point, other players have to agree if the person corresponds with the card's element.

Name: Fictionary
Description: A trivia type game where players must move inward along the different color tracks until one player reaches the mortarboard space while trying to figure out definitions to words.  The first player who picks the correct definition of the word while on the mortarboard space wins the game.

Name: Grabbin' Grasshoppers!
Description: Each player takes a net and on the count of three, presses four grasshoppers down on the board as fast as they can. In a few seconds, the suction cups will loosen and the grasshoppers will hop high into the air. The player who catches the most in his or her net wins.

Name: Hic!
Description: Start by preparing the cheatwell punch (recipe included).  Each person turns over one of their cards in front of them trying to find a match on the board between players.  When a match is spotted, Snap is called.  The two players who match, race to be the first to call their opponent something in the opponent's category beginning with 'A'.  The winner of the Snap does not have to drink.

Name: The $128,000 Question Game
Description:
Players compete in a test of knowledge, trying to win the most money by answering questions in the category of their choice.

Based on the TV game show of the same name, hosted by Mike Darrow (pictured on box) for its first season (1976-77).

Name: Creepy Crawlers
Description: Take over the house with the help of creepy crawlers bugs.  You can play with bugs inside this box, or with bugs you make in your creepy crawlers oven.  Players take turns moving, capturing room after room as their bugs swarm through the house.  The first player to capture three rooms wins the game.
